message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LG, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with optimization problems for Shannon information measures, which are commonly studied in information theory (cs.IT). The use of transportation polytopes and their connection to the SUBSET SUM and PARTITION problems suggests a connection to computational complexity (cs.DS, cs.CC). The introduction of new (pseudo)metrics on the space of discrete probability distributions suggests a connection to machine learning and data analysis (cs.LG). Finally, the study of optimization problems and their computational complexity is a common theme in theoretical computer science (cs.DM).
